Package controller

Class addProductFormController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.addProductFormController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class addProductFormController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    The addProductFormController class is used as the Controller for addProductFormScreen.fxml.
    Author:
    Mary Williams

    • Field Detail

      • associatedParts

        javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> associatedParts

    • Constructor Detail

      • addProductFormController

        public addProductFormController()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
        The initialize method sets the allParts and associatedParts tables to the allParts and associatedParts Observable Lists. It starts the allParts table with all Parts in the system, not filtering them to any search. Table placeholders are set in case there are no Parts in the system, or no Parts associated with the Product.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        url - Resource pointer used by initialize.
        resourceBundle - Locale-specific objects used by initialize.

      • partSearchTextF

        void partSearchTextF​(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
        The partSearchTextF method searches the allParts Observable List using Inventory.lookupPart, and sets the allPartsTableView to parts that match the search. Table placeholder is set in case no parts are found that match the search.
        Parameters:
        event - The KeyEvent that triggers this method. Every time the user types or deletes in the addProductSearch Text Field this method is called.

      • clearPartSearch

        void clearPartSearch​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        The clearPartSearch method clears the addProductSearch Text Field and resets the allPartsTableView list to allParts. Table placeholder is set in case there are no parts in the system.
        Parameters:
        event - The MouseEvent that triggers this method. When the user clicks back into the addProductSearch Text Field this method is called.

      • addProductAssociateButton

        void addProductAssociateButton​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        The addProductAssociateButton method associates a Part with the Product, adding it to the associatedParts Observable List, displaying it in the associatedPartsTableView. If there are no parts in the system to select from, or if there is nothing selected, this method instead shows a dialog box with a related error message.
        Parameters:
        event - The MouseEvent that triggers this method. When the user clicks on the 'Add' Button this method is called.

      • addProductDisassociateButton

        void addProductDisassociateButton​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        The addProductDisassociateButton method removes an associated Part from the Product, removing it from the associatedParts Observable List and from the associatedPartsTableView. If there are no associated parts, or if there is nothing selected, this method instead shows a dialog box with a related error message. It confirms that the user would like to remove a Part from being associated with the Product.
        Parameters:
        event - The MouseEvent that triggers this method. When the user clicks on the 'Remove Associated Part' Button this method is called.

      • addProductSaveButton

        void addProductSaveButton​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        The addProductSaveButton method checks that the user input valid data into each Text Field, creates a new Product, associates selected Parts with the new Product, and returns to mainFormScreen.fxml. Data validation checks performed include checking if any fields are empty, that reasonable doubles or integers are input into the correct fields, and logical checks for Price, Inv, Min, and Max. Dialog boxes with relevant error messages show up if the user has input anything incorrectly.
        Parameters:
        event - The MouseEvent that triggers this method. When the user clicks on the 'Save' Button this method is called.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Failed to load mainFormScreen.fxml.

      • addProductCloseButton

        void addProductCloseButton​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        The addProductCloseButton method closes the addProductFormScreen.fxml and returns the user to mainFormScreen.fxml. This method checks if the user has input anything into the text fields, sending them a confirmation that they would like to return without saving the product.
        Parameters:
        event - The MouseEvent that triggers this method. When the user clicks on the 'Cancel' Button this method is called.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Failed to load mainFormScreen.fxml.
